original_title: Hackaday Podcast 233: Chandrayaan on the Moon, Cyberdecks, Hackerspaces Born at a German Computer Camp
original_content:
This week, Editor-in-Chief Elliot Williams and Kristina Panos experimented with the old adage that brevity is the soul of wit. Thats right; this week, theyre all Quick Hacks, and thats to make room for a special series of interviews that Elliot recorded at CCCamp with the pillars of US hackerspace creation. This ones really special, do have a listen.
We still made room for the news this week: India launched Chandrayaan-3, which combines an orbiter, lander, and rover all in one. Then its on to the Whats That Sound results show, and while Kristina did not get it right, she did correctly identify it as being used in Whitney Houstons I Wanna Dance With Somebody, as did one of the guessers who identified it as the cowbell sound from a Roland 808.
Then its on to the (quick) hacks, where we alternated for once just to keep things interesting. This week, Elliot is into 3D printing a clay extruder and then printing pottery with that, z-direction conductive tape, and the humble dipole antenna. Kristina is more into cyberdecks for the young and old, a reusable plant monitor, and 3D printing some cool coasters.
Check out the links below if you want to follow along, and as always, tell us what you think about this episode in the comments!



Download and savor at your leisure.

Whats that Sound?

Congratulations to [Tjørnild] who correctly guessed the cowbell sound from a Roland 808!
As promised, heres Whitney.

title: 3Dプリントを利用した粘土押出器で自宅で陶芸を楽しもう！
body: 編集長のElliot WilliamsとKristina Panosが、簡潔さは知恵の精髄だという格言を実験しました。今週は特別なインタビューシリーズのためにクイックハックのみとなります。インドはChandrayaan-3を打ち上げ、オービタ、ランダー、ローバーを組み合わせました。その後、Whats That Soundの結果発表、そしてエリオットは3Dプリントのクレイ押出し器と陶器の印刷に興味を持ち、クリスティーナはサイバーデックと植物モニターに興味を持っています。
titles: 3Dプリントを利用した粘土押出器で自宅で陶芸を楽しもう！
サイバーデック: 若者と大人のための電子工作
持ち運びに便利な植物モニターを3Dプリントしよう
クールなコースターを3Dプリントしてテーブルを守ろう
USハッカースペース創造の柱とのインタビューを聞こう
